item.title: Array Indexing
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“Bryanc, post:20, topic:326423”]Actually Davidi is incorrect with his ‘enhanced for loop’, just a little bit…

You cannot loop int as it is not an object; you need to use Integer.

Anyways,

I do have to agree with Adam that things like that are something new to the community and people probably wouldn’t understand it, but it could of been introduced. It is his tutorial so it’s fine to do what he wants with it, as long as it does teach something. Which this does so good job.[/quote]you obviously do not understand the concept of primitive data type object wrappers…

Read full topic

item.title: Array Indexing
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

I didn’t de-rail anything, I just tried to get the point that the “[]” in the declaration can be in two places.
String[] args is the array which contains the command arguments; don’t take me for some kind of an idiot.

ps, learning command arguments is BASIC because once one knows the concept of arrays you will start speculating why an array is within the main method.

Read full topic

item.title: Array Indexing

item.description:
